vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in TokenBank.withdrawToHolder (patch_15.sol#67-76):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(addr.call.value(etherToWithdraw)()) (patch_15.sol#73)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- holders (patch_15.sol#74)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in TokenBank.withdrawTokenToHolder (patch_15.sol#55-65):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(token.call(bytes4(keccak256()(transfer(address,uint256))),to,tokensToWithdraw)) (patch_15.sol#62)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- holders (patch_15.sol#63)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function changeOwner(address addr) public onlyOwner {
        newOwner = addr;
vulnerability_findings.message: Ownable.changeOwner (patch_15.sol#11-13) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_15.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.19 (patch_15.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Token.withdrawToken (patch_15.sol#27-33):
	-require(bool)(token.call(bytes4(keccak256()(transfer(address,uint256))),to,amount)) patch_15.sol#32

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Function 'Ownable.Ownable' (patch_15.sol#7-9) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Function 'TokenBank.TokenBank' (patch_15.sol#40-43) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: State access after external call (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Read of persistent state following external call
The contract account state is accessed after an external call to a user defined address. To prevent reentrancy issues, consider accessing the state only before the call, especially if the callee is untrusted. Alternatively, a reentrancy lock can be used to prevent untrusted callees from re-entering the contract in an intermediate state.
Classification: SWC-107
